intro: Macrolenes neglecta, commonly known as the neglected macrolene, is a rare and lesser-known plant species with distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
